pear.threshold: hip_circ > bust_circ by 3+ inches AND WHR < 0.78

hourglass.threshold: bust approx hip (within 2"), waist < bust by 6+ inches, WHR 0.65-0.75

rectangle.threshold: bust approx waist approx hip (all within 4"), WHR 0.80-0.90

inverted_triangle.threshold: shoulder/bust > hip by 3+ inches, narrow hips

plus_size.threshold: size 16+ / bust > 42" or hip > 44" (can overlap any shape)

non_exclusive_note: Body types are NOT mutually exclusive. A woman can be PETITE + PEAR + PLUS SIZE simultaneously. The engine must layer modifiers from ALL applicable categories.

v_neck_elongation.base_mechanism: Medium V-neck (4" depth) elongation via Muller-Lyer wings-out

petite.mechanism: Neck elongation matters MORE on petite frames because every fraction of an inch is a larger percentage of total height. +1" on 60" body = 1.7% vs 1.3% on 68" body.

tall.mechanism: Already-long necks rarely need elongation. If neck > 4.5", may over-elongate to 'swan neck' effect. Score drops to +0.25 if neck > 5".

pear.mechanism: V draws eye upward, away from wider hips. Secondary: creates visual activity in upper body to balance heavier lower body.

apple.mechanism: Standard effect. V-neck diagonal lines provide mild torso slimming as secondary benefit (+0.15 waist dimension).

hourglass.mechanism: Slight reduction â€” hourglasses typically have proportional necks. V-neck PRIMARY value for hourglass is bust framing, not neck elongation.

rectangle.mechanism: V-neck vertical pull creates strongest available directional element on body lacking natural directional cues.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: V narrows visual focus of upper body. Converging diagonals counteract wide-shoulder horizontal. Dual: elongation + visual narrowing.

plus_size.mechanism: Depends on bust size. Bust <= D: standard (+0.60). DD-E: dividing begins (+0.40). F+: may be in dividing zone (+0.20). See Exception N-01.

petite.reason: Scale proportion - garment details proportional to frame size

tall.reason: Larger frame accommodates deeper V without dominating

apple.reason: Too deep risks revealing midsection posture

hourglass.reason: Lower threshold because bust projection makes V appear deeper than designed

hourglass_DD_plus.reason: Bust projection adds 1-2 effective inches to V-depth

rectangle.reason: Can go deeper - flat chest doesn't trigger dividing effect

inverted_triangle.reason: Standard V; too deep on wide chest can emphasize breadth

plus_size_large_bust.reason: Bust projection dramatically lowers dividing threshold

boat_neck_widening.base_mechanism: Widens perceived shoulders by +1.5 to +2.5" total via horizontal emphasis

petite.mechanism: Horizontal line across narrow frame creates strong widening ratio BUT can dominate small frame. If shoulder_width < 13": drops to +0.20. Risk: 'clothes hanger' effect.

tall.mechanism: Proportional effect. Tall frames have enough vertical space to balance the horizontal.

pear.mechanism: CANONICAL USE CASE. +2" widening brings shoulders closer to hip width, improving shoulder-hip ratio by 5-15%. If pear ALSO has short neck (<3"): drops to +0.35 (competing neck penalty).

apple.mechanism: Mild positive. Creates mild inverted triangle drawing attention upward. Positive but less transformative than for pear.

hourglass.mechanism: If shoulders < 14.5": +0.30. If shoulders >= 15.5": REVERSES to -0.40. Widening can push balanced silhouette into inverted triangle.

rectangle.mechanism: Creates visual taper to the (equally-wide) waist, suggesting narrower waist than actual.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: WORST COMBINATION. Already-wide shoulders become dramatically wider. Strongest reversal in entire neckline system.

plus_size.mechanism: PS pear: +0.60. PS apple: +0.20. PS wide shoulders: -0.30. Stiff fabric penalty: -0.15 if fabric_drape < 0.3.

turtleneck_shortening.base_mechanism: Full turtleneck shortens perceived neck by 2-3 inches plus column effect

petite.mechanism: Petite women MORE likely to have short necks. Turtleneck on already-short neck = neck disappears. Collar volume is larger proportion of face-to-shoulder zone. Double amplification.

tall.mechanism: Tall women often have long necks (>4.5"). Turtleneck SHORTENS long neck toward proportional. Chunky knit on 5'9"+ with 5" neck: perceived neck becomes 2.5-3.0" (proportional).

pear.mechanism: Standard shortening, slightly less critical because visual focus for pear is lower body, not neck zone.

apple.mechanism: Apple often carries weight in upper body/face. Turtleneck adds cylinder to already-full upper body = monolithic column effect.

hourglass.mechanism: Proportional neck is shortened below average. Unbroken line from collar to bust emphasizes bust on already-full hourglass bust. If bust DD+: overall drops to -0.65.

rectangle.mechanism: Neither wide hips nor large bust to compound with. Less damaging because no secondary amplification.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: Adds mass to upper body zone where inv. triangle already has excess. Collar volume + broad shoulders = visually heavy top.

plus_size.mechanism: Compounds: (1) larger neck circumference = more fabric/mass, (2) full/round face amplified, (3) large bust monolithic column. EXCEPTION: Plus-size + tall + long neck = REVERSES to +0.55.

wrap_compound.base_mechanism: Compound: V-elongation + diagonal slimming + waist definition + bust accommodation

petite.mechanism: Waist definition proportionally more impactful on smaller frames. ONE CAVEAT: petite + very slim (size 0-2), excess fabric bunches. Score drops to +0.10.

tall.mechanism: Still positive but waist definition and elongation less impactful because tall frames already have length. 'Nice' rather than 'transformative.'

pear.mechanism: V draws eye up + waist definition shows pear's typically-defined waist + diagonal slims torso. Top 3 neckline for pear.

apple.mechanism: Waist-definition mechanism FAILS. Tie adds 0.3-0.5" bulk to widest point. If WHR > 0.88: visible 'belt of bulk'. Waist dim: -0.15. V still works (+0.50), diagonal still works (+0.15). At WHR > 0.92: overall DROPS to -0.10.

hourglass.mechanism: PEAK PERFORMANCE. Showcases natural waist, V frames bust, tie cinches at narrowest. EXCEPTION: DD+ bust + silk/satin + tie_only: CRASHES to -0.40 (gaping).

rectangle.mechanism: CREATES waist definition rectangle doesn't have naturally. Gathered tie point manufactures a waist.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: V narrows upper visual + diagonal sweeps away from shoulders. One of best necklines for inverted triangle.

plus_size.mechanism: PS hourglass: +0.65. PS pear: +0.55. PS apple: -0.10 to +0.10. PS DD+ bust: GAPING RISK. If bust > 44" AND tie-only: drops to -0.30.

cowl_bust_volume.base_mechanism: Adds +1.5 to +2.5" of front chest volume via drape

petite.mechanism: Cowl drape proportionally larger on small frame. Enhancement risks overwhelming. Minimization penalty amplified.

tall.mechanism: Volume proportionally smaller on tall frame. Enhancement effective without overwhelming.

pear_small_bust.mechanism: Small bust on pear = cowl adds upper body volume that BALANCES wider lower body. Dual: bust enhancement + upper body counterbalance.

apple.mechanism: Already carries weight in upper body. Enhancement limited. Minimization strongly negative.

hourglass_DD_plus.mechanism: WORST COMBINATION FOR MINIMIZATION. Cowl on DD+ bust = maximum perceived chest mass. Enhancement near zero (bust already proportional).

rectangle.mechanism: Creates visual interest and volume in upper body zone rectangle lacks.

inverted_triangle_small_bust.mechanism: Fills chest area between wide shoulders making upper body less skeletal. If bust >= C: drops to +0.10.

plus_size.mechanism: Enhancement mild. Minimization extreme. Chunky knit cowl on plus-size: minimization reaches -1.0.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: Same mechanism as boat neck - widens already-wide shoulders

cap_sleeve_widening.base_mechanism: Cap at arm's widest point adds +0.30 to +0.50" perceived arm diameter

petite.mechanism: Proportionally shorter upper arms = cap covers LARGER percentage of total arm. Percentage widening is larger (3.3% on 9" arm vs 2.5% on 12" arm).

tall.mechanism: Longer arms = cap covers less proportional length. Eye has more 'normal arm' to reference below cap.

pear.mechanism: Pear doesn't inherently change arm proportions.

apple.mechanism: Apple often carries additional upper arm weight. Cap frames WIDER widest point. Severity multiplier from arm prominence > 1.80.

rectangle.mechanism: More uniform arm profiles = less dramatic peak for cap to frame.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: Often has developed deltoids/upper arms. Cap sits on already-wide shoulder-to-arm zone. EXCEPTION: If user_goal = 'showcase_muscle': REVERSES to +0.45.

plus_size.mechanism: Plus-size arms 14-18" circumference. Cap frames maximum, compression and muffin-top effect. Single strongest negative in entire sleeve system.

slim_arms_showcase.reason: Slim toned arms FRAMED attractively by cap.

flutter_cap_any_arm.reason: Soft edge + no compression + movement = 0.60 score swing vs rigid cap.

muscular_arms_showcase.reason: Cap frames peak muscle definition. Deltoid and bicep are features.

three_quarter_sleeve_slimming.base_mechanism: Terminates at forearm narrowest - OPTIMAL for arm slimming

petite.mechanism: CRITICAL EXCEPTION: On petite arms (<21"), standard 3/4 (17" from shoulder) reaches WRIST, not forearm narrowest. Functions as full-length sleeve. FIX: recommend 'elbow length' garments (14-15" from shoulder) for actual 3/4 position.

tall.mechanism: Opposite: on tall arms (>25"), standard 17" sleeve ends at MID-FOREARM, 2-3" above narrowest. FIX: need '7/8 sleeve' or 'below elbow' for actual 3/4 position.

pear.mechanism: Pear doesn't typically affect arm proportions.

apple.mechanism: Apple arms often have higher prominence ratio (more dramatic peak-to-narrowest). Creates LARGER delta = more slimming.

rectangle.mechanism: More uniform arms = less dramatic peak. Slimming delta smaller.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: If goal is slimming: +0.80. If goal is 'showcase muscle': reduced to +0.40 (hides muscular upper arm).

plus_size.mechanism: HIGHEST SCORE FOR ANY BODY TYPE. Largest absolute difference between C_upper_arm_max and C_forearm_min. On arms with C_max 16" and C_min 10": perceived width drops from ~5.1" to ~3.2" diameter - 37% reduction.

petite.mechanism: SCALE PENALTY: -0.32. Volume occupies larger proportion of frame. If petite + short neck (<2.5"): puff compresses neck. Neck penalty: -0.35. Net widening: +0.13.

tall.mechanism: Tall frames absorb puff proportionally. Most architecturally elegant on tall frames. No scale penalty.

pear.mechanism: +3-4" widening can bring shoulders within 1" of hip width. Most powerful single element for pear balance. Petite pear net: +0.58.

apple.mechanism: Apple doesn't need widening as critically. If apple + plus-size: drops to +0.30 (combined upper body volume overwhelming).

hourglass.mechanism: Already balanced. Puff WIDENS shoulders beyond hips = converts hourglass to inverted triangle. If bust DD+: additional -0.30.

rectangle.mechanism: Creates shoulder width rectangle lacks, establishing visual taper implying waist narrowness.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: DO NOT RECOMMEND. Amplifies primary body imbalance to maximum. Deeply negative regardless of framing.

plus_size.mechanism: PS pear: +0.60. PS apple: +0.25. PS hourglass: +0.15. PS rectangle: +0.45. Fabric stiffness penalty: -0.15 if stiff AND size > 20.

flutter_cap_vs_rigid.base_mechanism: Flutter cap provides 0.60 point swing vs rigid cap due to soft edge + no compression + movement

above_knee_elongation.base_mechanism: Each inch above knee adds +0.5 to +0.7" perceived leg extension

petite.mechanism: HIGHEST VALUE. Each inch of above-knee exposure has proportionally MORE impact. 3" above-knee on 5'1" shows same absolute leg as 1" above-knee on 5'7", but PROPORTIONAL impact 2x greater.

tall.mechanism: Already-long legs need less elongation. If legs already > 62% of height: further elongation can create 'legs too long' imbalance. At >4" above knee on tall + long-legged: drops to +0.15.

pear.mechanism: CRITICAL TENSION: elongates legs (positive +0.50) AND reveals widest zone (upper thighs). If thigh_circ > 24": thigh penalty -0.25, net +0.25. If thigh_circ > 27": penalty -0.40, net +0.10.

apple.mechanism: Apple typically has SLIM LEGS relative to midsection. Above-knee SHOWCASES apple's best asset.

rectangle.mechanism: Visible leg below hem is one of few zones where rectangle has visible shape (calf muscle, knee contour). More visual interest.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: Typically narrower hips/thighs making above-knee proportionally easy to wear.

plus_size.mechanism: PS + slim legs (apple distribution): +0.50. PS + full thighs: +0.15. PS + proportional legs: +0.35.

below_knee_safe_zone.base_mechanism: Safe zone between knee danger zone and calf danger zone

petite.mechanism: ZONE COLLAPSES. Under 5'3": knee-to-calf averages 3.5-4.5". After subtracting danger zones, safe zone shrinks to 0-1". If safe_zone < 1.0": -0.10. If safe_zone < 0": -0.25.

tall.mechanism: Generous safe zone (5-7"). Longer visible calf below hemline creates pleasing proportion.

pear.mechanism: Mildly positive (covers widest thigh). If prominent calves (calf_prominence > 1.3): drops to +0.10.

rectangle.mechanism: More uniform legs = less dramatic calf = smaller danger zone. Position matters less.

plus_size.mechanism: PS + muscular calves: +0.10 (expanded danger radius). PS + slim lower legs (apple): +0.35. PS + proportional: +0.25.

midi_length.base_mechanism: Lower calf position. Score varies +0.15 to -0.50 depending on actual anatomical landing

petite.mechanism: THE TRANSLATION PROBLEM AT ITS WORST. Midi designed for 5'9" model lands at COMPLETELY DIFFERENT position on 5'1" body. Can land at WIDEST CALF. Must compute ACTUAL hem position, not trust label.

tall.mechanism: On tall bodies, midi hits mid-calf to lower calf - flattering, proportional. Reads as intentionally elegant.

apple.mechanism: Apple's slim lower legs revealed. Covers midsection and hip area.

rectangle.mechanism: Doesn't add visual interest to rectangle's uniform silhouette.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: Adds visual weight/length to lower body, helping balance heavy upper body.

plus_size.mechanism: PS + petite: strongly negative (calf collision). PS + tall: +0.25. PS + prominent calves: negative.

ankle_length_elongation.base_mechanism: Frames at narrowest point + creates long unbroken vertical line

petite.mechanism: OVERWHELM THRESHOLD. Slim column: +0.35 (maximally elongating). Full A-line/gown: -0.20 (volume swallows frame). Thresholds: slim > 60", moderate > 62", full > 64" effective height. Waist definition shifts threshold by -2".

tall.mechanism: One of strongest hemlines for tall. Can wear full-volume ankle-length without overwhelm. Ankle break is proportional and elegant.

pear.mechanism: Covers entire hip-thigh zone. Long line from waist to ankle counteracts horizontal emphasis of wide hips.

apple.mechanism: Covers midsection, creates vertical line. BUT must skim not cling. If fabric clings to belly: drops to -0.10.

hourglass.mechanism: MUST have waist definition. With: +0.35. Without: +0.10 (shape loss penalty).

rectangle.mechanism: Long vertical line is rectangle's BEST friend. Column ankle-length on rectangle: +0.40.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: Long line adds visual weight below. Full-skirt ankle-length particularly effective.

plus_size.mechanism: PS + tall: +0.40 (excellent). PS + petite: -0.15 (overwhelm). PS + waist definition: +0.25.

empire_waist_elongation.base_mechanism: Shifts perceived legs longer by 2-4 inches

petite.mechanism: Benefits most from leg elongation. If petite + empire + mini: torso appears EXTREMELY short (perceived torso < 20%), torso proportion: -0.35.

tall.mechanism: Already-long legs. If torso-to-leg ratio < 0.35: REVERSES to -0.25 (worsens existing imbalance).

pear.mechanism: Elongates legs + raises waist above widest hip zone. Fabric skims over hips.

apple.mechanism: Empire seam above widest point. Flowing fabric covers midsection. BUT if bust >= DD + stiff fabric: TENT EFFECT. Score crashes to -0.30.

hourglass.mechanism: Empire CONCEALS natural waist (best feature). Fitted through torso: +0.10. Flows from underbust: -0.20. DD+ bust + stiff fabric: -0.40 (tent + hides waist). HOSTILE to hourglass unless stretchy.

rectangle.mechanism: No natural waist to LOSE. Empire seam CREATES a waist point. Flowing fabric suggests hip width.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: Flowing lower half adds visual volume below bust, counterbalancing wide shoulders.

plus_size.mechanism: Bust projection typically > 3". Tent effect in MAJORITY of cases with medium-to-stiff fabric. SAVES: stretchy (+0.20), gathering (+0.25), lightweight/drapey (+0.15). Without: NEGATIVE recommendation.

fit_and_flare_proportion.base_mechanism: Creates perceived hourglass proportions via fitted waist + flared skirt

petite.mechanism: Positive with volume caveat. Combined with upper body volume (puff, cowl): double-volume overwhelm, drops to +0.15. Optimal: simple upper body.

tall.mechanism: Tall frames absorb flare proportionally. Creates dramatic elegant proportions.

pear.mechanism: Counter-intuitive: can AMPLIFY hip width if flare begins AT or BELOW widest hip. Only positive if flare begins ABOVE widest hip. If flare_origin below hip: drops to -0.15.

apple.mechanism: Fitted bodice must accommodate wide midsection. Proper fit: +0.40 (manufactures shape). Poor fit: -0.25 (visible strain). MOST sensitive to fit quality.

hourglass.mechanism: ECHOES natural shape. Fitted at natural waist, flared at natural hip. Amplifies existing body shape.

rectangle.mechanism: HIGHEST SCORE FOR ANY BODY TYPE. Most to gain - least natural proportion differentiation. Perceived WHR reduction: 8-15%. Single most transformative element for rectangle.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: Flare adds hip volume to balance wide shoulders. Fitted waist creates transition. Becomes hourglass silhouette within garment.

plus_size.mechanism: PS rectangle: +0.60. PS hourglass: +0.55. PS apple: +0.10 to +0.40 (fit quality). PS pear: +0.15 (risk of amplifying). Minimum flare angle for PS: 20 deg (vs 10 deg standard).

dark_color_slimming.base_mechanism: Dark clothing creates 2-5% perceived size reduction

petite.mechanism: Contrast at waist adds definition monochrome loses. Monochrome creates 'dark block'. Dark + contrast always better for petite.

tall.mechanism: Less sensitive to shape-loss effect. Longer vertical provides structural interest even in monochrome.

pear.mechanism: All-dark slims uniformly but pear's lower body (needs slimming most) slimmed equally with upper (doesn't need). Dark bottom + lighter top is 2x more effective.

apple.mechanism: Monochrome dark smooths waist-into-hip transition. Contrast risks drawing attention TO waist zone.

hourglass.mechanism: All-dark ERASES waist-hip differential (best feature). Body reads as dark column at widest width. Shape loss (-0.30) exceeds slimming (+0.15). Net: -0.15.

rectangle.mechanism: No waist to 'reveal' with contrast. Uniform dark column is DESIRABLE. Contrast risks 'striped' effect emphasizing LACK of waist curve.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: Dark top + lighter bottom draws eye DOWN from wide shoulders. Much more effective than uniform dark.

plus_size.mechanism: Genuine slimming proportionally more visible on larger frames. If PS apple (WHR>0.85): mono better. If PS hourglass (WHR<0.78): contrast better.

horizontal_stripes.base_mechanism: Effect depends on body size per Ashida body-size model

petite.mechanism: Petite bodies typically in SLIM range where H-stripes have thinning effect (Helmholtz). H may SLIM by 3-4%. V-stripes can make petite look WIDER. CONTRADICTS popular advice.

pear.mechanism: H on narrow upper body: +0.10 (Helmholtz works). H on wider lower body: -0.10. Engine should score stripes IN EACH ZONE independently.

apple.mechanism: Midsection is widest zone. Ashida reversal suggests H adds 2-3% width. V provides mild slimming. Confidence MEDIUM.

hourglass.mechanism: Waist-hip differential dominates perception regardless of stripe direction.

rectangle.mechanism: H on typical average-to-slim proportions provides Helmholtz thinning AND adds suggestion of horizontal contour rectangle lacks.

inverted_triangle.mechanism: H on upper body (wide): possible -0.10 widening. H on lower body (narrow): possible +0.10. Best strategy: H bottom, solid dark top.

plus_size.mechanism: Above Ashida reversal threshold. H produces mild widening. V produces mild slimming. HERE popular advice approximately correct but effect MUCH smaller than believed (2-4%).

apple.mechanism: Belt HIGHLIGHTS widest circumference. Inverts from +0.35 to -0.35.

plus_size.mechanism: Depends on WHR. If defined waist: positive. If WHR > 0.85: negative.

above_knee_hemline.note: Split difference. Optimal: 2-3 inches above knee (not mid-thigh).

below_knee_hemline.note: Petite zone collapse + pear thigh-covering need fight each other. Unreliable.

puff_sleeve.note: Pear amplification partially offsets petite scale penalty. BEST single element. Choose SMALL puffs.

ankle_length_column.note: Requires waist definition and slim silhouette. Full-skirt drops to +0.05.

petite_pear.best_strategy: V-neck medium (+0.70) + small puff/structured shoulder (+0.58) + above-knee at 2-3 inches (+0.45) + nude heel (+0.45). Compound: approx +0.65

empire_waist.note: AVOID unless stretchy/gathered. Tent + overwhelm = double negative.

above_knee.note: If legs proportionally slim (apple): strong positive.

three_quarter_sleeve.note: UNIVERSALLY EXCELLENT. Use 'elbow length' garments for correct positioning.

monochrome_dark.note: Column elongation + genuine slimming. ADD waist definition to prevent block effect.

petite_plus_size.best_strategy: V-neck at 3.5" + 'elbow-length' sleeves (actual 3/4) + dark A-line at 2" above knee + nude heel. Compound: approx +0.60

v_neck_medium.note: EXCELLENT. V narrows upper body while providing proportional elongation.

fit_and_flare.note: Flare adds hip volume. Tall frame absorbs flare proportionally.

full_ankle_length_skirt.note: Volume of full skirt creates lower-body mass counterbalancing wide upper body.

tall_inverted_triangle.best_strategy: V-neck medium (+0.65) + raglan/dropped shoulder (-0.50 shoulder reduction) + fit-and-flare wide flare (+0.60). Compound: approx +0.70

wrap_dress.note: UNRELIABLE. Only works with: snap closure + stretchy fabric + internal structure.

above_knee_fitted_top.note: STRONG STRATEGY. Dark fitted (not tight) top + above-knee skirt = hides concern, showcases best asset.

belt_at_waist.note: AVOID. Belt draws attention to widest circumference.

apple_plus_size.best_strategy: V-neck at 3" + dark structured top with vertical seaming + A-line/straight skirt 2-3" above knee + 3/4 sleeves. Compound: approx +0.60

critical_reversals.description: Cases where a principle's effect CHANGES SIGN for a body type. Most important entries because they represent active harm when following standard rules.

reversals.why: Shortens long neck to proportional - desirable
Safe zone collapses - danger zones overlap
Hits widest calf on petite frame
Erases waist definition - shape loss > slimming
Tent effect on large bust projection
Ashida reversal - Helmholtz inverts on wider bodies
Tie adds bulk to widest point
Amplifies hip width instead of balancing
Same mechanism as boat neck - widens wide shoulders

master_lookup_matrix.description: Quick-reference score matrix. Scores for PRIMARY goal per body type.
